#summary The screen.top property
#labels about-dom,is-dom-property,from-mozilla

== Values ==

The `screen.top` property returns an integer.

In [BrowserFamilyFirefox Firefox], the value of the `screen.top` property is the top edge of the current screen, in pixels.  If you only have one monitor, this will always be `0`, but if you have multiple monitors, then its value depends on your monitor setup.

This property is read-only.
